visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a column chart with the title 'Tallest Buildings'. The chart should display the height of various buildings, with each column filled with a pattern corresponding to an image of the building. The x-axis should be categorical, with labels styled with a font size of 18px. The y-axis should display the height in feet, with labels formatted to show the unit 'ft'. The chart should have a scrollable plot area with a minimum width of 460 pixels. The legend should be disabled, and the tooltip should display the name and height of the building when hovering over a column.

subtitle.text: An infographic demo with the pattern fill module

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a column chart titled 'Tallest Buildings'. The chart includes a subtitle indicating it's an infographic demo utilizing the pattern fill module. The x-axis is categorical, with labels styled to have a font size of 18px. The y-axis displays the height of buildings in feet, with labels formatted to include the unit 'ft'. Each column in the chart represents a building, with its height and a pattern fill corresponding to an image of the building. The chart is set to be scrollable with a minimum width of 460 pixels, and the legend is disabled. The tooltip, when activated by hovering over a column, displays the name and height of the building.
